intro: Spermacoce aristeguietana, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes approximately 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Spermacoce aristeguietana is often found in areas with high humidity and is known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal practices.
